description: After weeks of unrest and eroded Council authority, Lenart Kova uses his systems expertise to quietly seed the People’s Ledger, bypassing remaining BCI controls. He informs key resistance leaders, initiating a citywide shift.

The People’s Ledger formally launches. Citizens, including the previously erased, contribute records and resources. Public coordination begins to shift away from BCI channels as Ledger access spreads rapidly.

Neighborhood groups organize distribution of essentials and information through the Ledger. Trust in the grassroots system grows as BCI scoring is broadly ignored in daily interactions, further sidelining Council authority.

Mass gatherings in central squares call for Council abolition and formal recognition of the Ledger as the new civic foundation. An attempted crackdown by Directorate loyalists falters due to lack of public support.

With the majority participating in People’s Ledger forums, a public vote dissolves the Council. An open process to draft Stenograd’s new citizen-written charter begins, guided by diverse voices including those once erased.
